main event: Military pilots and radar operators observed an unidentified flying object over Guthrie and Parkersburg, West Virginia on December 11, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as round to crescent-shaped, blue in color, and larger than an aircraft.
The object was tracked on ground radar, but the pilots initially thought it was the moon.
The object moved erratically, sometimes hovering and then resuming high speed up to Mach 1.5.
Multiple military sources, including pilots and radar operators, corroborated the sighting.
sighted object: a round to crescent-shaped blue object
photographs: yes, the report indicates photographs were taken
